page.title: 12TOURISM
page.content: Visitors to the area willing to risk the vagaries of the climate are amazed at the natural beauty of the countryside-gently undulating pasture land giving way in the east to stark moorland,all dominated by the imposing presence of Pendle Hill. Noyna rocks and Kelbrook woods are very popular with hikers,ramblers and casual walkers,whilst the disused railway line between Colne and Skipton is of great interest to naturalists interested in hedgerow flora and fauna. The mile tunnel on the Leeds- Liverpool canal is a fascinating feature of Foulridge history and pleasure cruises along the canal are increasingly popular. The nearby historic town of Skipton gives easy access to the beauties of the Yorkshire Dales.
